intro: Pilosella longisquama subsp. eucomoides, commonly known as the European piloselle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are hairy and linear, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
